newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian interbank rates high, demand huge.
newsitem.headline: Croatian interbank rates high, demand huge.

text.p: Croatian money market rates stayed high in active morning trade on Friday, with good supply barely matching extraordinary demand for kuna funds, dealers said.
"Every Friday is unpredictable due to usual announcements of tax and other payments," one dealer said.
"Banks want to secure funds for the weekend but we managed to persuade them to grant some loans, so demand has been met in full," she said.
Fresh borrowings were 30.2 million kuna, mostly granted at 11 percent, unchanged from Thursday.
Insurers granted one seven-day loan at 9.0 percent and one 30-day loan was struck at 16 percent.
No banks reported shortfalls in Thursday's overnight trade but 16.2 million kuna were granted for maintenance of their statutory reserves.
